snippet: For decades, mental health organizations have featured speakers with various disorders. But until now, discussing suicide attempts has been virtually off limits.
abstract: American Association of Suicidology votes to recognize those within its ranks that have survived attempts to kill themselves; mental health organizations have encouraged speakers willing to share personal stories about various disorders, but suicide has been taboo topic; shame and stigma have been an issue along with fear that discussing act could give others specific ideas about how to kill themselves.
lead_paragraph: For decades, mental health organizations have featured speakers with various disorders. But until now, discussing suicide attempts has been virtually off limits.

headline.main: Suicide Prevention Sheds a Longstanding Taboo: Talking About Attempts
headline.print_headline: Suicide Prevention Sheds a Longstanding Taboo: Talking About Attempts
